user_request: Write a villanelle about the inevitability of change.
final_poem:
In transient halls of fleeting light
The wind whispers secrets, wild and free
Change comes with dawn's inevitable night

We grasp for what we have in sight
But like a mirage, it slips from me
In transient halls of fleeting light

Leaves turn to rustle, then decay to night
And all that's left is memory
Change comes with dawn's inevitable night

 Memories of joy and love now lost in flight
Leave only longing, sorrowing deep sea
In transient halls of fleeting light

Yet still we hold on to what has been the might
Of yesterday, when heart was full and free
Change comes with dawn's inevitable night

And though our grasp may falter or take flight
Still it is not the end that we must see
In transient halls of fleeting light

rhyme_analysis.expected_scheme: ABA ABA ABA ABA ABA ABAA
